p: In December 2019, a novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) was observed in 3 patients with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases from Wuhan, China. By the end of March 2020, the virus spread all over the globe and caused a large global outbreak [24]. On January 30 2020, the WHO declared the COVID-19 outbreak as the sixth public health emergency of international concern, following H1N1 (2009), polio (2014), Ebola in West Africa (2014), Zika (2016) and Ebola in the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019) [25,26].Â WHO announced a COVID-19 outbreak as pandemic on Mar 12, 2020.
